Ratings.comment: The class was easy. He was flexible with deadlines. I took the online async course in session 1. He was hesitant to accept my SLDS accomodations though at the beginning of the year and I never got them implemented. (I ended up not needing them for this course since it was so flexible).
He was very understanding with deadlines and helpful. Overall, super easy survey course.

This is one of the easiest classes I have ever had. The class is a 1-unit, pass/fail that basically reviews how to sign up for classes on your own and the advisement process. There are a few assignments, tests, and discussions, but they are all easy to complete. Also, the course is over halfway through the semester making it even easy and helpful.

Professor Bitters is a very kind guy and helps students as much as he can. Since this was a survey course and attendance was mandatory, the lectures could get pretty boring because there was not a lot of content to lecture about. Only a few assignments in this course so if you apply yourself its an easy pass.
